entry_headline: RYAN TEDDER RISES
entry_abstract: As one of pop music’s preeminent hit makers Ryan Tedder can do it all: write brilliant songs, produce dazzling tracks, and create magic with his instantly identifiable voice. First emerging as the lead vocalist for the band OneRepublic, Tedder has artfully augmented his career as the band’s front man with songwriting and production projects for a spectrum of top artists and projects.

entry_abstract: The Hives have revealed details about their highly anticipated, forthcoming album, “Lex Hives,” to Todd Martens at the Los Angeles Times music blog, Pop & Hiss.

entry_headline: NO DOUBT REVEALS SEPTEMBER ALBUM RELEASE DATE
entry_abstract: No Doubt have announced their first album in over a decade will be released on September 25. TheComet.com has a preview video on “Push & Shove,” a brand new track from the album, featuring Major Lazer and Jamaican artist Busy Signal.

entry_headline: LITTLE DRAGON TAPES ABSOLUT ‘ENCORE! SESSIONS’ IN NEW YORK
entry_abstract: According to BillboardBiz.com, Little Dragon will conclude the fifth installment of the “Encore! Sessions,” sponsored by Absolut vodka, on May 22. The series documents intimate artist performances at Le Baron in New York’s Chinatown. Read more about it here. http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/backbeat/backbeat-little-dragon-teams-with-absolut-1006979362.story?imw=Y

entry_headline: KOBALT WINS UK INDIE PUBLISHER OF YEAR

entry_headline: MAX MARTIN & SHELLBACK WIN TOP SMFF AWARD IN SWEDEN
entry_abstract: Kobalt congratulates Max Martin & Shellback for winning SMFF "International Success of the Year."

entry_headline: SUPERHEAVY DEBUTS FEATURING KOBALT CLIENTS DAVE STEWART AND JOSS STONE
entry_abstract: LOS ANGELES, CA -- Rock, soul, reggae and pop royalty have come together and formed a cooperative project called Superheavy comprising of Mick Jagger, Eurythmics founder Dave Stewart, soul singer Joss Stone, Academy Award-winning composer A.R. Rahman and reggae star Damian Marley.

entry_headline: JOSS STONE CHOOSES KOBALT FOR GLOBAL ADMIN DEAL
entry_abstract: NEW YORK, NY -- Grammy Award and two-time Brit Award winning artist Joss Stone has signed an exclusive, worldwide administration deal with Kobalt Music Group (Kobalt). Through the deal Kobalt will represent her next solo album, LP1, which is to be released by her newly established label Stone'd Records in partnership with Surfdog Records on August 1 in the U.K. and the rest of the world on July 26. Co-written and produced by Eurythmics co-founder Dave Stewart and friends, LP1 is the first album Stone has recorded with total creative freedom.

entry_headline: KOBALT CLIENTS RECEIVE TOP HONORS AT ASCAP POP AWARDS CEREMONY IN HOLLYWOOD
entry_abstract: Top ASCAP awards were presented to Kobalt clients Lukasz "Dr. Luke" Gottwald and Max Martin, who were both named Songwriters of the Year.

entry_headline: KOBALT TOASTS WRITER SHANE MCANNALLY’S FIRST NO. 1 SINGLE “SOMEWHERE WITH YOU” BY KENNY CHESNEY
entry_abstract: NASHVILLE, TN -- U.S. performance societies ASCAP and BMI recently held a party to toast Kenny Chesney's critically acclaimed, multi-week chart-topping single, "Somewhere With You," which was co-written by Kobalt Nashville writer Shane McAnally and songwriter JT Harding. The song was the first No. 1 for both writers. "Somewhere With You" is Chesney's remarkable 21st No.1 single. American Airlines' Cindy Hutchings, Manager Promotions Midwest Region, commemorated the achievement by providing the writers each with two roundtrip tickets to the destination of their choice.

entry_headline: KRISTIN GUNDRED OF DUM DUM GIRLS INKS NEW DEAL WITH KOBALT
entry_abstract: LONDON, U.K. -- Kobalt Music Group has signed Kristin Gundred lead singer of U.S. act Dum Dum Girls in an exclusive worldwide administration deal which includes their debut album, I Will Be (Sub Pop), and other works.

entry_headline: KOBALT U.K. TEAM CELEBRATES SIGNING OF BECKY JONES OF SAINT SAVIOUR
entry_abstract: LONDON, U.K. -- Sas Metcalfe, Kobalt's Executive VP Creative (pictured left), and Nick Robinson, Kobalt Senior VP Business Development (pictured right), celebrate the new signing of UK artist and songwriter Becky Jones (center) at Kobalt Music Group worldwide headquarters in London.

entry_headline: KOBALT CLIENTS WIN 13 ASCAP AWARDS INCLUDING SONGWRITER OF THE YEAR
entry_abstract: Kobalt client Lukasz "Dr. Luke" Gottwald won ASCAP Songwriter of the Year at the ASCAP Pop Awards held in Los Angeles.  Dr. Luke's successful year has included the writing and producing of such hit songs as "Hot N Cold" by Katy Perry, "My Life Would Suck Without You," by Kelly Clarkson, "Circus" by Britney Spears, "Party in the USA" by Miley Cyrus, and "Right Round" by Flo Rida.

entry_headline: KOBALT MUSIC GROUP WINS INDEPENDENT MUSIC PUBLISHER OF THE YEAR AWARD
entry_abstract: LONDON, U.K. -- Kobalt Music Group (Kobalt) has been awarded Independent Music Publisher of the Year at the Music Week Awards held in London. The winner of the award is determined by market share of the top selling albums and singles of 2009 in the U.K. The award marks Kobalt's second consecutive win.

entry_headline: KOBALT RANKS TOP INDIE PUBLISHER IN US AIRPLAY FOR SEVENTH CONSECUTIVE QUARTER
entry_abstract: NEW YORK, NY-- Billboard Magazine has reported that Kobalt Music Group (Kobalt) received an 8.3% share of the US publishing market in ranking by radio airplay in the fourth-quarter of 2009.

entry_headline: KOBALT CLIENTS PHOENIX AND RYAN TEDDER CELEBRATE GRAMMY AWARD WINS
entry_abstract: LOS ANGELES, CA -- At the 52nd Annual Grammy Awards held in Los Angeles, Kobalt client Phoenix won Best Alternative Music Album for their critically acclaimed album, Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix (Glassnote Records). Phoenix's Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix received critical praise across the board, and was named in the Top 5 Albums of 2009 by TIME Magazine, Rolling Stone, Spin, MySpace, Pitchfork, and over 100 other publications.

entry_headline: KOBALT WRITERS DOMINATE SWEDISH AWARDS
entry_abstract: In Stockholm Max Martin received Composer of the Year and the award for "Most Played Song" on radio went to Max Martin and Johan "Shellback" Schuster for Pink's "So What."

entry_headline: KOBALT POSTS BIGGEST US MARKET SHARE GAIN AND RANKS AS NO. 1 UK INDIE MUSIC PUBLISHER
entry_abstract: Through a string of successes from clients, Kobalt Music Group enters the Top 5 in U.S. airplay and takes No.1 independent music publisher slot in the U.K.
